thread.title: Online lender Social Finance’s latest fundraising implies $4 billion valuation
thread.title_full: Online lender Social Finance’s latest fundraising implies $4 billion valuation - MarketWatch

author: Peter Rudegeair ,     Rolfe Winkler ,   and   Telis Demos
title: Online lender Social Finance’s latest fundraising implies $4 billion valuation
text:
Fast-growing online lender Social Finance Inc. has raised about another $1 billion from investors, giving the startup a roughly $4 billion valuation that would place it in the top 30 U.S. banks by market capitalization.
Based in San Francisco and typically called SoFi, the company raised the new round of equity in recent weeks, according to a document reviewed by The Wall Street Journal and a person familiar with the matter.
The fundraising round would make the four-year-old lender among the most-highly valued financial-technology, or “fintech,” companies with aspirations of stealing business from traditional banks.
An expanded version of this report appears at WSJ.com.
More from MarketWatch
